Row.Text: The World War Era
Information Era
Information
IE
Future Era
Future
FE
Researching this new technology will unlock new buildings, wonders, units and elite units.
Researching this new technology will unlock new buildings, wonders, units and elite units. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tile Improvement[ENDCOLOR] construction speed increased by 25%.
Fishery

Generally, a fishery is an entity engaged in raising or harvesting fish which is determined by some authority to be a fishery. According to the FAO, a fishery is typically defined in terms of the "people involved, species or type of fish, area of water or seabed, method of fishing, class of boats, purpose of the activities or a combination of the foregoing features". The definition often includes a combination of fish and fishers in a region, the latter fishing for similar species with similar gear types.
"Many men go fishing all of their lives without knowing that it is not fish they are after." [NEWLINE] - Henry David Thoreau
Hunting

Hunting has a long history and may well pre-date the rise of the species Homo sapiens. While our earliest Hominid ancestors were probably frugivores or omnivores, there is evidence that earlier Homo species,[3][4] and possibly also australopithecine[5] species, utilised larger animals for subsistence. Evidence from western Kenya suggests that hunting may have occurred as long ago as two million years.[6]
"There is no hunting like the hunting of man, and those who have hunted armed men long enough and liked it, never care for anything else thereafter." [NEWLINE] - Ernest Hemingway
Aesthetics
Aesthetics (also spelled æsthetics) is a branch of philosophy dealing with the nature of art, beauty, and taste, with the creation and appreciation of beauty.
“Beauty is how you feel inside, and it reflects in your eyes. It is not something physical.” [NEWLINE] ― Sophia Loren
Administration
Management in businesses and organizations is the function that coordinates the efforts of people to accomplish goals and objectives by using available resources efficiently and effectively.
“When one with honeyed words but evil mind. Persuades the mob, great woes befall the state.” [NEWLINE] ― Euripides, Orestes
Marine Engineering

Marine engineering often refers to the engineering of boats, ships, oil rigs and any other marine vessel or structure, but also encompasses oceanographic engineering. Specifically, marine engineering is the discipline of applying engineering sciences, and can include mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, electronic engineering, and computer science, to the development, design, operation and maintenance of watercraft propulsion and also on-board systems and oceanographic technology, not limited to just power and propulsion plants, machinery, piping, automation and control systems etc. for marine vehicles of any kind like surface ships, submarines etc.
"Beware of little expenses. A small leak will sink a great ship." [NEWLINE] - Benjamin Franklin
Sonar

Sonar (originally an acronym for Sound Navigation And Ranging) is a technique that uses sound propagation (usually underwater, as in submarine navigation) to navigate, communicate with or detect objects on or under the surface of the water, such as other vessels.
“Dominate the enemy by striking first.” [NEWLINE] - Ban Gu
Military Logistics

The word "logistics" is derived from the Greek adjective logistikos meaning "skilled in calculating". The first administrative use of the word was in Roman and Byzantine times when there was a military administrative official with the title Logista. At that time, the word apparently implied a skill involved in numerical computations.
"Gentlemen, the officer who doesn't know his communications and supply as well as his tactics is totally useless." [NEWLINE] - Gen. George S. Patton
Advanced Engineering

Aeronautical Engineering deals with aircraft design while Aerospace Engineering is a more modern term that expands the reach envelope of the discipline by including spacecraft design. Its origins can be traced back to the aviation pioneers around the turn of the century from the 19th century to the 20th although the work of Sir George Cayley has recently been dated as being from the last decade of the 18th century. Early knowledge of aeronautical engineering was largely empirical with some concepts and skills imported from other branches of engineering. Only a decade after the successful flights by the Wright brothers, the 1920s saw extensive development of aeronautical engineering through development of World War I military aircraft. Meanwhile, research to provide fundamental background science continued by combining theoretical physics with experiments.

Researching this new technology will unlock new buildings, wonders, units and elite units. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tile Improvement[ENDCOLOR] construction speed increased by 25%. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Allows [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Workers[ENDCOLOR] to move across the mountain or the ice.
“One man's magic is another man's engineering. Supernatural is a null word.” [NEWLINE] ― Robert A. Heinlein
Large Calibre Artillery System

Large calibre artillery systems: Guns, howitzers, artillery pieces, combining the characteristics of a gun or a howitzer, mortars or multiple-launch rocket systems, capable of engaging surface targets by delivering primarily indirect fire, with a calibre of 100 millimetres and above.
"The artillery is a god of modern war." [NEWLINE] - Joseph Stalin
Urbanization
Urbanization is a population shift from rural to urban areas, "the gradual increase in the proportion of people living in urban areas", and the ways in which each society adapts to the change.
"Urbanization is the advent of edge species." [NEWLINE] - Kevin Kelly (1995) Out of Control: The New Biology of Machines, Social Systems and the Economic World
Mobilization

Mobilization is the act of assembling and making both troops and supplies ready for war. The word mobilization was first used, in a military context, in order to describe the preparation of the Russian army during the 1850s and 1860s. Mobilization theories and techniques have continuously changed since then. The opposite of mobilization is demobilization.
"I want you for U.S. Army" [NEWLINE] - J. M. Flagg's 1917 poster
Integrated Circuit

An integrated circuit or monolithic integrated circuit (also referred to as an IC, a chip, or a microchip) is a set of electronic circuits on one small plate ("chip") of semiconductor material, normally silicon.
"If the presence of electricity can be made visible in any part of the circuit, I see no reason why intelligence may not be transmitted instantaneously by electricity." [NEWLINE] - Samuel Morse
Composite Material

Composite materials (also called composition materials or shortened to composites) are materials made from two or more constituent materials with significantly different physical or chemical properties, that when combined, produce a material with characteristics different from the individual components.
"The whole is greater than the sum of its parts." [NEWLINE] - Aristotle
Advanced Flight

Little did the Wright Brothers know that less than four decades after their first plane touched down in the North Carolinian sand, aeronautical engineers would have already created a completely new way to power flight - the jet engine. The jet engine would find further application in the creation of the helicopter.
"Oh! I have slipped the surly bonds of Earth, put out my hand and touched the face of God! " [NEWLINE] - John Gillespie Magee
Electronic Surveillance
Surveillance is the monitoring of the behavior, activities, or other changing information, usually of people for the purpose of influencing, managing, directing, or protecting them.
"Know yourself and know your enemy, and you will never be defeated. " [NEWLINE] - Sunzi's Art of War
Artificial Intelligence

Artificial intelligence (AI) is the intelligence exhibited by machines or software, and the branch of computer science that develops machines and software with intelligence. Major AI researchers and textbooks define the field as "the study and design of intelligent agents",[1] where an intelligent agent is a system that perceives its environment and takes actions that maximize its chances of success.
"The appropriately programmed computer with the right inputs and outputs would thereby have a mind in exactly the same sense human beings have minds." [NEWLINE] - John Searle
Genetic Engineering

Genetic engineering, also called genetic modification, is the direct manipulation of an organism's genome using biotechnology. New DNA may be inserted in the host genome by first isolating and copying the genetic material of interest using molecular cloning methods to generate a DNA sequence, or by synthesizing the DNA, and then inserting this construct into the host organism.

"With genetic engineering, we will be able to increase the complexity of our DNA, and improve the human race. But it will be a slow process, because one will have to wait about 18 years to see the effect of changes to the genetic code." [NEWLINE] - Stephen Hawking
Automation

Automation or automatic control, is the use of various control systems for operating equipment such as machinery, processes in factories, boilers and heat treating ovens, switching in telephone networks, steering and stabilization of ships, aircraft and other applications with minimal or reduced human intervention. Some processes have been completely automated.

"The first rule of any technology used in a business is that automation applied to an efficient operation will magnify the efficiency. The second is that automation applied to an inefficient operation will magnify the inefficiency." [NEWLINE] - Bill Gates
Internet of Things

The Internet of Things (IoT) is the network of physical objects or "things" embedded with electronics, software, sensors, and network connectivity, which enables these objects to collect and exchange data. The Internet of Things allows objects to be sensed and controlled remotely across existing network infrastructure, creating opportunities for more direct integration between the physical world and computer-based systems, and resulting in improved efficiency, accuracy and economic benefit. Each thing is uniquely identifiable through its embedded computing system but is able to interoperate within the existing Internet infrastructure. Experts estimate that the IoT will consist of almost 50 billion objects by 2020.

"Without going outside his door，one understands all that takes place under the sky；without looking out from his window，one sees rules of the universe. The farther that one goes out from himself，the less he knows." [NEWLINE] - Lao-Tzu
BVR Combat

The term beyond-visual-range missile (BVR) usually refers to an air-to-air missile (BVRAAM) that is capable of engaging at ranges of 20 nmi (37 km) or beyond. This range has been achieved using dual pulse rocket motors or booster rocket motor and ramjet sustainer motor.
"In modern war... you will die like a dog for no good reason." [NEWLINE] - Ernest Hemingway
Superconductor

Superconductivity is a phenomenon of exactly zero electrical resistance and expulsion of magnetic fields occurring in certain materials when cooled below a characteristic critical temperature. It was discovered by Dutch physicist Heike Kamerlingh Onnes on April 8, 1911 in Leiden. Like ferromagnetism and atomic spectral lines, superconductivity is a quantum mechanical phenomenon.
"To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk." [NEWLINE] - Thomas Edison
Transhumanism

Transhumanism (abbreviated as H+ or h+) is an international and intellectual movement that tries to transform the human condition by developing and creating widely available technologies to greatly enhance human intellectual, physical, and psychological capacities.
"What use was time to those who'd soon achieve Digital Immortality?" [NEWLINE] - Clyde DeSouza, Memories With Maya
Space Technology

Space technology – technology developed by space science or the aerospace industry for use in spaceflight, satellites, or space exploration. Space technology includes spacecraft, satellites, space stations, and support infrastructure, equipment, and procedures. Space is such a novel environment that attempting to work in it requires new tools and techniques.
"The universe is so big, but compared with human ambition, it is so small." [NEWLINE] - Lincoln_lyf, the author of Superpower Mod of Sid Meier's Civilization V (2015)
Metamaterial

Metamaterials are materials engineered to have properties that have not yet been found in nature. They are made from assemblies of multiple elements fashioned from conventional materials such as metals or plastics. The materials are usually arranged in repeating patterns, often at microscopic or smaller scales that are smaller than the wavelengths of the phenomena they influence. Metamaterials derive their properties not from the properties of the base materials, but from their designed structure. Their precise shape, geometry, size, orientation and arrangement gives them their properties.
"Man never made any material as resilient as the human spirit." [NEWLINE] - Bernard Williams
Photon Computer

Optical or photonic computing uses photons produced by lasers or diodes for computation. For decades, photons have promised to allow a higher bandwidth than the electrons used in conventional computers.
"Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower." [NEWLINE] - Steve Jobs
Interstellar Travel

Interstellar space travel is manned or unmanned travel between stars. The concept of interstellar travel via starships is a staple of science fiction. Interstellar travel is conceptually much more difficult than interplanetary travel.
"Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness." [NEWLINE] - Mark Twain
Intergrated Defense

The Strategic Defense Initiative (SDI) was proposed by U.S. President Ronald Reagan on March 23, 1983,[1] to use ground-based and space-based systems to protect the United States from attack by strategic nuclear ballistic missiles.
"War is Peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength." [NEWLINE] - Nineteen Eighty-Four by George Orwell
Advanced Mechanized Infantry
Incredibly fast and powerful, this late-game Unit require Aluminum to be built.

Advanced Mechanized Infantry are stronger and faster than Mechanized Infantry. In addition to fast, Advanced Mech Infantry move after combat like Modern Armor and can heal even we in make an action; A mix between the Infantry and the armored vehicles.

Unit powered with exoskeleton, also known as powered armor, or exoframe, is a powered mobile machine consisting primarily of an exoskeleton-like framework worn by a person and a power supply that supplies at least part of the activation-energy for limb movement. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]These depictions can be described as a battlesuit with mechanical and electronic mechanisms designed to augment the wearer's abilities. Other power armors are portrayed as being much larger, more like a bipedal vehicle the size of a tank or much larger. The line between mecha and power armor is necessarily vague.
Distributed Computing
Distributed Computing

The advancement of computing systems has increasingly resulted in their distribution across a wider network of computers. Parallel processing allows computations to be conducted more quickly, as various calaculations can be carried out simultaneously, while distributed computer networks create systems that are more flexible and resilient against mechanical failure, as they are no longer limited to single machines.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Vertols[ENDCOLOR], a hovering military unit, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Arsenal Ships[ENDCOLOR], a futuristic ranged naval unit, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Research Servers[ENDCOLOR] which increase [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Autoplants[ENDCOLOR] which increase [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"All of a sudden, we've lost a lot of control. We can't turn off our internet; we can't turn off our smartphones; we can't turn off our computers." -- Steve Wozniak[NEWLINE][TAB]
Environmentalism
Environmentalism

The increasing awareness of ecological systems and how they work has, in turn, lead to concerns about the impact of human activity upon them. Environmentalism is a broad social movement that emphasizes environmental protection and the health of the environment. It advocates for the lawful preservation, restoration, and improvement of the natural environment, and typically seeks to control pollution and encourage natural diversity.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Geothermal Plants[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tidal Plants[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Also allows Workers to construct [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nature Preserves[ENDCOLOR], which provide [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"We have lived our lives by the assumption that what was good for us would be good for the world. We have been wrong. We must change our lives so that it will be possible to live by the contrary assumption, that what is good for the world will be good for us. And that requires that we make the effort to know the world and learn what is good for it." -- Wendell Berry[NEWLINE][TAB]
Augmented Reality
Augmented Reality
High-Energy Physics
High-Energy Physics

The field of high energy physics is guided by intertwined science drivers to explore the elementary constituents of matter and energy, the interactions between them, and the nature of space and time. While much of this research is theoretical, it does have practical applications in the develop of things such as electromagnetic weaponry, or the advancement of space exploration and development through the creation of ion engines for spacecraft, or improved power plants that can be used in orbit.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Railgun Armor[ENDCOLOR], a futuristic armor unit, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Information Hubs[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Physics is the only profession in which prophecy is not only accurate but routine."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Neil deGrasse Tyson[NEWLINE][TAB]
Orbital Development

While national governments still have the most resources to invest in space exploration, commercial enterprises have become increasingly interested in the opportunities of privatized access to space. Either way, orbital development holds opportunities for both research and industrial production, as well as helping facilitate and maintain increasingly complex orbital communication networks.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mycoprotein Vats[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_FOOD] Food production, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Space Stations[ENDCOLOR] to increase the number of Specialists in a city.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The exploration and use of outer space,including the moon and other celestial bodies, shall be carried out for the benefit and in the interests of all countries, irrespective of their degree of economic or scientific development, and shall be the province of all mankind."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Article 1 of the Treaty on Principles Governing the Activities of States in the Exploration and Use of Outer Space, Including the Moon and Other Celestial Bodies[NEWLINE][TAB]
Implants
Implants

As the methods of genetic manipulation become increasingly refined, the possibiilty of using genetics to produce more effective organs and organic components increases. While the wholescale manipulation of the human genome would produce more effective results, the sheer complexity of the task makes it easier to focus on engineering organic components to specific standards, even if the rest of the host body suffers significant problems. While there are some concerns about the ethics of using these engineered host bodies to incubate augmented organs, they do prove to be increasingly valuable and useful, whether in enhancing the productivity and effectiveness of workers, or in making more powerful soldiers for the battlefield.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Biodrones[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Organic Infantry[ENDCOLOR], futuristic units that can heal themselves, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Implant Clinics[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"And he causeth all, both small and great, rich and poor, free and bond, to receive a mark in their right hand, or in their foreheads: And that no man might buy or sell, save he that had the mark, or the name of the beast, or the number of his name."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Revelations, the Bible[NEWLINE][TAB]
Neural Interface
Neural Interface

As machines have become increasingly sophisticated, the interfaces required to interact with them have as well. Being able to control a machine with one's thoughts as an extension of one's body would be an incredible achievement, making it far simpler to perform complex tasks with mechanical assistance. However, the brain is itself a highly complex organ, and achieving a direct interface a significant challenge. Still, progress is being made in establishing connections between computers and other technological devices and human nerves, allowing both motor control and sensory input of technological devices.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cybersubs[ENDCOLOR], the most advanced submarine unit.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"A picture is worth a thousand words. An interface is worth a thousand pictures."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Ben Shneiderman[NEWLINE][TAB]
Cognitive Technology
Cognitive Technology

As the capability to produce increasingly small-scale devices develops, so has the capacity to integrate computer systems into practically any item or material, and with the development of networked computing, allows appliances or other objects to be made increasingly "smart". A smart home, for example, can monitor activity in various rooms, adjusting lighting or temperature as needed to conserve power. Smart appliances can monitor usage and even determine when to place orders for new food or other supplies as needed. Furthermore, even simple "smart" systems acting in concert can display increasingly intelligent emergent behavior.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Drone Fighters[ENDCOLOR], the most advanced fighter unit, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Network Backbones[ENDCOLOR], which increases [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Digital behavior is just a replication of human behavior."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Paul Papadimitriou[NEWLINE][TAB]
Microscale Engineering

The development of nanomaterials demonstrated that it is possible to manipulate matter on molecular and even atomic scales to produce new materials and structures. The next challenge in the search of true nanotechnology is to produce actual working components on this scale -- power sources, motors, and other mechanical parts to allow nanoscale machines to undertake tasks. Increasingly sophisticated tools are devised to allow the manipulation of molecules on the nanoscale level, which in turn makes sophisticated and futuristic materials much more common and available.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mech Artillery[ENDCOLOR], a futuristic siege unit, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Hypervelocity Missiles[ENDCOLOR], the most powerful missile unit. Also allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Converters[ENDCOLOR] to produce more [ICON_NANOMAT] Nanomaterials.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Infinities and indivisibles transcend our finite understanding, the former on account of their magnitude, the latter because of their smallness; Imagine what they are when combined."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Galileo Galilei[NEWLINE][TAB]
Designer Lifeforms
Designer Lifeforms

While the genetic modification of the human genome holds the most promise for human augmentation, it is a highly complex endeavor as the human genome is the product of millions of years of evolution. A simpler undertaking is to take much simpler genomes, such as those found in plants and animals, in order to modify them more drastically -- or even produce entirely new genomes. In time, experimentation with genetic manipulation lead to the capability to craft and engineer entirely new organisms, leading to the term "gengineering", a portmanetau of the term "genetic engineering". With the capbility to engineer living organisms to fill specific ecological niches and other roles, it becomes increasingly possible to manipulate the environment to meet particular needs or desires.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Chimeras[ENDCOLOR], genetically engineered combat units, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Biogenesis pods[ENDCOLOR] which increase the production of Mutants and Chimeras, and provide newly created units with unique promotions.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"If you realize that all things change, there is nothing you will try to hold on to. If you are not afraid of dying, there is nothing you cannot achieve."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching[NEWLINE][TAB]
Biomodification

While the term "gengineering" refers to the creation of entirely new organisms through genetic manipulation, biomodification reflects taking existing organisms and modifying them to improve their capabilities in various ways. In particular, modification of the human genome allows the adaptation of individuals to augmented forms that can meet a variety of needs, whether it be strength and durability in combat, or the ability to work in hazardous environments. As biomodfication becomes increasingly prevalent, more environments become available to humans to live and work, although the definition of what constitutes being "human" starts to become blurred.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Biotroopers[ENDCOLOR], the most powerful genetically-engineered infantry, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Bioenhancement Centres[ENDCOLOR] which increase the production of Mutants and Chimeras, and provide newly created units with unique promotions, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Genejack Facilities[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"As human beings, our only sensible scale of values is one based on lessening the agony of existence."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - H.P. Lovecraft[NEWLINE][TAB]
Artificial Environments

Manned exploration and inhabitation of outer space will require significant advances in the technologies available to sustain humans in one of the most hostile environment possible. In particular, self-sustaining environments that can provide breathable atmosphere, drinkable water, and food will be needed. These technologies will not be applicable only to space travel, however, as it will enable us to create self-contained environments underground, in arid regions, or under the ocean, greatly increasing the volume of space available for human habitation.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Vertical Farms[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Hydroponics Domes[ENDCOLOR] in order to increase [ICON_FOOD] Food output, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Geofronts[ENDCOLOR] to improve city defense.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The more artificial a human environment becomes, the more the word 'natural' becomes a term of value."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Wendell Berry[NEWLINE][TAB]
Adamantium

As atomic nuclei grow larger, the binding energy that holds them together becomes weaker, making heavier elements unstable and prone to radioactive decay. However, it is predicted that certain superheavy nuclei (with approximately 300 nucleons) would achieve stability as the nucleons are arranged in more stable configurations. Generating such atoms is a difficult challenge, however, as even the nuclei that could be fused to achieve such elements are in rare supply, and incredible amounts of energy and precision would be required to synthesize them. However, the advent of fusion power plants and the precision engineering required to manufacture nanoscale machines do make it a possibility, and such superheavy elements would be valuable as both a raw material and as a potential power source.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Giant Death Robots[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Battlesuits[ENDCOLOR], the most powerful armor and infantry units in the game. Also allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nucleonic Foundries[ENDCOLOR] which provide [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_NANOMAT] Nanomaterials.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The tricky thing about adamantium is, that if you ever manage to process its raw, liquid form, you got to keep it that way, keep it hot. Because once the metal cools, it's indestructible."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - X-Men[NEWLINE][TAB]
Arcologies

The term 'arcology' is a portmaneteau of the words 'architecture' and 'ecology', and is a vision of architectural design principles for very densely populated habitats. An arcology is distinguished from a merely large building in that it is designed to lessen the impact of human habitation on any given ecosystem. Adapting to life within an arcology would likely require social and cultural adaptation as well, with an increased emphasis on frugality and shared social resources, and a lessening of private space.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aerospace Complexes[ENDCOLOR], which increase the air capacity of a City, [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Orbital Habitats[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_FOOD] Food, and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Central Command[ENDCOLOR], which improves Information Hubs, Distribution Hubs, and Metroplex Hubs across the empire. Also allows Workers to construct [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Arcologies[ENDCOLOR], which provide [ICON_GROWTH] Food and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Architecture is the physical form of the ecology of the human, the configuration of matter which allows for the best energetic and willful flux"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Paolo Soleri[NEWLINE][TAB]
Artificial Intelligence
Artificial Intelligence

Artifical intelligence is the intelligence exhibited by machines and software. Although technically any intelligent agent is one that can perceive its environment and undertake actions that maximize its chances of success, colloquially the term refers to a machine or software that displays a notable degree of self-awareness and sentience, displaying a human-like level of intelligence. With the development of "smart" devices and other forms of cognitive technology, achieving this goal becomes a possibility, although there are some concerns that, as such intelligences may not think in a truly "human" fashion, they may become rivals or otherwise hostile towards humanity. Still, as intelligent behavior may be defined as being logical or human-like, it is also possible such new intelligences would be benevolent or friendly towards humanity, so long as humanity acted intelligently themselves.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]AI Networks[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I think, therefore I am"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Rene Descartes[NEWLINE][TAB]
Cybernetics
Cybernetics

Although cybernetics as a science is broadly concerned the study of systems of any nature which are capable of receiving, storing, and processing information so as to use it for control, its study of the connection between stimulus and action lends itself to the common perception of the study of interfaces between humans and machines, and how mechanical sensors and agents might be integrated with human decision-making processes. However, cybernetics can also be applied to such things as purely mechanical systems (studying artificial intelligence and emergent behavior), as well as biological and social systems.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Hovertanks[ENDCOLOR], the most advanced mobile unit in the game, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Telepresence Hubs[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The world of the future will be an even more demanding struggle against the limitations of our intelligence, not a comfortable hammock in which we can lie down to be waited upon by our robot slaves." -- Norbert Weiner[NEWLINE][TAB]
Ecotheory
Ecotheory

While environmentalism has been a social movement concerned with the preservation of nature against human activity, it does also have the drawback of regarding both "nature" and "humanity" as separate and distinct from each other. As the study of ecological systems progresses, increasing movements that seek to view both humans and their environment more holistically start to develop, encouraging people to view themselves as part of a single, unified system. Some of the more radical proponents of these new ecological philosophies (or "ecosophies") advocate that thought should be given to modifying both humans and the environment so they can live in greater harmony with each other -- with competing needs, simply preserving both humanity and the environment as they are is likely to lead to further conflict.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ecosanctuaries[ENDCOLOR] which provide [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Biofactories[ENDCOLOR] which provide [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Every living being is connected intimately, and from this intimacy follows the capacity of identification and as its natural consequences, practice of non-violence."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Arne Næss[NEWLINE][TAB]
Nanomaterials
Nanomaterials

Nanomaterials research takes a materials science-based approach to nanotechnology, leveraging advances in materials metrology and synthesis which have been developed in support of microfabrication research. Materials with structure at the nanoscale often have unique optical, electronic, or mechanical properties.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Power Armor Infantry[ENDCOLOR], a futuristic infantry unit, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nanomaterial Plants[ENDCOLOR] which provide Nanomaterials. Also allows Workers to construct [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Generators[ENDCOLOR], which provide [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Carbon atoms on a distant planet rearranged themselves into DNA, microorganisms formed, grew backbones, swam around the ocean, mutated into amphibians and crawled onto dry land — and finally a cab appeared at the mouth of the alley."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Mark Coggins, "The Immortal Game"[NEWLINE][TAB]
Transgenics
Transgenics

As the technology to clone existing organisms matured, it also permitted the increasing development of new, genetically modified organisms that incorporated previously nonexistent traits that could breed true in future generations. Most transgenic organisms could only grow and develop under controlled environments, such as specialized plant nurseries, but new ecotheories helped scientists understand the complex interactions in ecologies and environments, allowing more stable transgenic organisms that could survive in open environments without upsetting the existing ecological balance.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tidal Arrays[ENDCOLOR], which increase the Production and Gold output of coastal cities, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Transgenic Nurseries[ENDCOLOR] which improve Forests, Jungles, and Marshes.Also allows Workers to construct [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Genocentres[ENDCOLOR], which provide [ICON_GROWTH] Food, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Nothing is so painful to the human mind as a great and sudden change."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Mary Shelley, Frankenstein[NEWLINE][TAB]
Cloning
Cloning

The advancing study of biology and medicine lead to the creation of methods for artifical gestation, and manipulation of organisms on a cellular level. Once the ability to incubate organisms artifically in a laboratory environment was achieved, attention was turned to the capability to replicate particularly useful organisms, eventually leading to the search for some means to replicate an actual human being. Still, while it is possible to replicate an organism genetically, that organism may not mature into an identical twin of its predecssor, due to environmental influences.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Clone Labs[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aquaculture Labs[ENDCOLOR], which enhance nearby resources.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Why would you clone people when you can go to bed with them and make a baby? C'mon, it's stupid."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Ray Bradbury[NEWLINE][TAB]
Genetic Manipulation
Genetic Manipulation

With the discovery of DNA, and the increasing ability to manipulate organisms on a genetic level, it was inevitable that some would investigate the effects of manipulating the genetic composition of organisms, in an effort to improve them in various ways. Genetic manipulation can be highly problematic, however, as even simpler organisms that have been genetically modified may prove to have unintended biological and environmental effects. The possibility of human genetic modification is an issue with many social and ethical concerns, although some feel the potential benefits would outweigh such risks.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mutants[ENDCOLOR], a cheap infantry unit that can heal itself, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gene Labs[ENDCOLOR], which provide a bonus to certain resources, as well as increasing the production of [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"We cannot become what we need to be, remaining what we are."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Max De Pree[NEWLINE][TAB]
Memetics
Memetics

Memetics is the study of the development and spread of memes -- self-contained units that carry cultural ideas, symbols, or practices that can be transmitted from one mind to another. They are considered by some to be a cultural analogue to genes, in the way they replicate, mutate, and respond to selective pressures. The study of memetics may help us understand how societies and cultures develop and evolve over time, although some suggest it may ultimately also help people manipulate and shape socieities into more desirable forms.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Entertainment Servers[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_CULTURE] Culture output, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]VR Training Centres[ENDCOLOR] to help train veteran units. Also allows Workers to construct [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Eco-Communes[ENDCOLOR], which provide [ICON_GROWTH] Food, [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Not even the most heavily-armed police state can exert brute force to all of its citizens all of the time. Meme management is so much subtler; the rose-tinted refraction of perceived reality, the contagious fear of threatening alternatives."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Peter Watts, Blindsight[NEWLINE][TAB]
Autonomous Systems
Autonomous Systems

As cognitive technology advanced, fully autonomous mechanical systems became increasingly feasible. While not fully sentient or self-aware, these systems were capable of sufficiently complex decision-making that they could handle unexpected circumstances. This allowed human operators to provide simpler instructions and commands, and mechanical systems required less oversight, making them increasingly practical in real-world environments rather than controlled settings.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Advanced Destroyers[ENDCOLOR], the most powerful naval melee unit, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Drone Hives[ENDCOLOR] which provide [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Borehole[ENDCOLOR], which improves Geothermal Plants and Mines. Also allows Workers to construct [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Support Nodes[ENDCOLOR], which provide [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and heal nearby units each turn.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Never do anything yourself that others can do for you."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Agatha Christie, The Labours of Hercules[NEWLINE][TAB]
Hyperstructures
Hyperstructures

Expanding upon the concept of the arcology towards urban development, advances in materials engineering and other technologies may someday make it feasible to accomplish tremendous feats of engineering -- housing an entire city of people in a single structure, designed to optimize human comfort and society while minimizing their impact on the surrounding environment. Such a structure would be a tremendous accomplishment, and would undoubtably have an equally great impact upon human society.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Crawlers[ENDCOLOR], the most powerful siege unit, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Metroplex Hubs[ENDCOLOR], which provide [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"Men have become the tools of their tools"[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - David Thoreau [NEWLINE][ TAB ]
Microscale Engineering

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Infinities and indivisibles transcend our finite understanding, the former on account of their magnitude, the latter because of their smallness; Imagine what they are when combined."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Galileo Galilei[NEWLINE][TAB]
Homo Superior
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I teach you the Overman. Man is something which shall be surpassed."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Friedrich Nietzsche[NEWLINE][TAB]

With the full maturation of both biomodfication and cybernetics, it becomes possible to augment the human body in almost limitless ways. Human beings can be stronger, smarter, live longer and be relatively free from disease or injury. While there are ethical and even logistical concerns with such human augmentation, it would leave humanity poised to transcend its limitations.
Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Stasis Chamber[ENDCOLOR], which is one of the spaceship components required for the Science Victory.
Digital Society
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"If you stay right where you are, then people will eventually come to you."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Robert Doisneau[NEWLINE][TAB]

With the proliferation of artificial intelligences, as well as the advancement of cybernetics allowing humans to utilize mind-machine interfaces and telepresence, the concept of the mind and personality being linked to one's physical body becomes increasingly outmoded. Advances in computer networks and technology allow people to project themselves anywhere on the planet, or perceive entirely artifical worlds. Ultimately, such a society may discard concerns about the physical world, with identity being determined solely by one's mind, rather than one's body, and one's perceptions may be determined largely by one's interactions with the electronic environment humanity lives in.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Brain Uploading Facilities[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture but reduce population.
Smart Materials
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Everything changes, nothing remains without change."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Siddhārtha Gautama[NEWLINE][TAB]

The culimination of nanotechnology would be the development of "smart materials" -- materials that are actually comprised of intelligent nanomachines, capable of adapting themselves to their environments or other stimuli. Nanomachines like these, working in concert, would allow humans to have complete control over their environments -- construction shelters or other objects upon demand. Depending on the nature and distribution of the nanomachines, they could also serve other roles, such as personal defense or even transportation.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nexus[ENDCOLOR] units, a powerful carrier and support unit, as well as the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Utility Fog[ENDCOLOR], which improves city defense and increases [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
Energy Theory
[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration."[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - Nikola Tesla [NEWLINE][ TAB ]

The human investigation of the principles under which the universe operates have lead to investigations of the functioning of the universe at the smallest and most high-energy states. The most evident products of this research can be found in the extended exploration and development of the solar system, resulting in powerful booster engines capable of propelling spacecraft between interplanetary colonies, as well as facilitating the development of new generations of space stations and bases on other worlds.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Boosters[ENDCOLOR], one of the spaceship components required for the Science Victory, as well as the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Factory[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Moon Base[ENDCOLOR].
Terraforming
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Man does not weave this web of life. He is merely a strand of it. Whatever he does to the web, he does to himself."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Chief Seattle[NEWLINE][TAB]

Mankind has always sought to control and defend itself against the ravages of its environment, developing clothing and shelter to protect ourselves, and eventually finding ways to turn it to our advantage. But as we've learned to control humanity, we've also become aware of the impact we ourselves have upon the world around us. The culimination of this development may be the eventual development of means of terraforming -- transforming the entire environment around us as needed. Manipulating plants, animals, and terrain, we could adapt new planets to become habitable, or adjust our own to become more tolerable.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Bio-Titans[ENDCOLOR], a powerful melee unit which can spawn [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Genospawn[ENDCOLOR] units when enemies are nearby.
Space Colonization
[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"There is no easy way to the stars from the earth."[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - Seneca [NEWLINE][ TAB ]

Humanity has always felt an underlying desire to explore and expand, to find what lies beyond the horizon. Outer space provides the ultimate frontier, a broad expanse that humanity can expand into and explore. The achievement of a level of technology that would permit humans to travel to another star system may be as pivotal in human history as the development of the first tools.
Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Engine[ENDCOLOR], which is one of the spaceship components required for the Science Victory.
Computronium
[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"Men are only as good as their technical development allows them to be."[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - George Orwell [NEWLINE][ TAB ]

Computronium is a material hypothesized by Norman Margolus and Tommaso Toffoli of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology to be used as "programmable matter," a substrate for computer modeling of virtually any real object.
Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Cockpit[ENDCOLOR], which is one of the spaceship components required for the Science Victory.
Human Augmentation

[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"Mind you, I've always wondered if Kei wasn't one of those Yamashita upgrades -- you know, with too much adrenocorticotropic hormone, too little monoamine oxidase?"[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - Adam Warren, A Plague of Angels [NEWLINE][ TAB ]

With the development of both genetic biomodification and cybernetics, limitless possibilities for human augmentation became possible. Virtually any component of the human body could be replaced with a vat-grown or cybernetic replacement. Eventually, however, some began to see baseline humanity as the limitation, as it could only accept so much modification, and more experimentation began on establishing improved versions of the human genome.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Birthing Pods[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Suborbital Bombers[ENDCOLOR], the most powerful bomber unit, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Fusion Plants[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Distribution Hubs[ENDCOLOR] to increase [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in your cities.

Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]XCOM Squad[ENDCOLOR] and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nanohive[ENDCOLOR], as well as the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nanoforge[ENDCOLOR] to increase military unit production.
Cloning Lab

+2 [ICON_FOOD] Food from [ICON_RES_SHEEP] Sheep and [ICON_RES_COW] Cows and +2 Production from [ICON_RES_HORSE] Horses and [ICON_RES_BISON] Bison. 15% of the [ICON_FOOD] Food is carried over when a [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen is born. Requires a Genemod Lab. Cannot be built if the city already has a Vertical Farm, Mycoprotein Vats, or Orbital Habitat.

+2 [ICON_FOOD] Food from [ICON_RES_SHEEP] Sheep and [ICON_RES_COW] Cows and +2 Production from [ICON_RES_HORSE] Horses and [ICON_RES_BISON] Bison. 15% of the [ICON_FOOD] Food is carried over when a [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen is born. Requires a Genemod Lab. Cannot be built if the city already has a Vertical Farm, Mycoprotein Vats, or Orbital Habitat.

The earliest experiments in cloning were conducted on farm animals. As human cloning has a variety of ethical concerns, the most likely uses of cloning in the near future will be to increase the productivity of animal herds.
Aquaculture Lab
Sea resources worked by the city produce +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Requires a Lighthouse, and city must not contain an Undersea Mining Platform.
+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and [ICON_GOLD] Gold from sea resources.

As various scientific methods were used to improve crops and animal herds, it was inevitable that similar techniques would be applied to increasing the availability of animals that lived in the sea. Various experimentation in 'aquaculture' has lead to various methods of maximizing the yields that can be gained from the various animals in the sea.
Genemod Lab

+2 [ICON_FOOD] Food from [ICON_RES_WHEAT] Wheat, [ICON_RES_BANANA] Bananas, [ICON_RES_DEER] Deer, and [ICON_RES_FISH] Fish. Cannot be built if the city already has a Vertical Farm, Mycoprotein Vats, or Orbital Habitat.

+2 [ICON_FOOD] Food from [ICON_RES_WHEAT] Wheat, [ICON_RES_BANANA] Bananas, [ICON_RES_DEER] Deer, and [ICON_RES_FISH] Fish. Cannot be built if the city already has a Vertical Farm, Mycoprotein Vats, or Orbital Habitat.

As techniques to manipulate genetic information were improved, experimentation upon a wider range of subjects began. New crops and animals were developed as a response to increasing issues of food supplies.
Transgenic Nursery

Forest tiles produce an extra 1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, Jungle tiles produce an extra 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and Marsh tiles produce an extra 1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION]. Requires a Cloning Lab. Cannot be built if the city already has a Vertical Farm, Mycoprotein Vats, or Orbital Habitat.

Forest tiles produce an extra 1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, Jungle tiles produce an extra 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and Marsh tiles produce an extra 1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION]. Requires a Cloning Lab. Cannot be built if the city already has a Vertical Farm, Mycoprotein Vats, or Orbital Habitat.

Studies of the spread of genetically modified plants and animals in existing ecosystems, combined with refinements in genetic modification and engineering, lead to increased efforts to expand beyond just modifying individual organisms, but to entire ecosystems. Transgenic nurseries were used as preliminary test environments to develop new, self-sustaining ecologies that grew more effectively and were more productive than naturally-ocurring ones. Once satisfactory results had been achieved, these new ecosystems were introduced into the wild, quickly supplanting the existing ones.
Biogenesis Pod

+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from each worked Forest tile. Increases the production of Mutants, Chimeras, and Bio-Titans. Melee, Gun, Ranged, and Scout units receive the Gengineered promotion. Requires a Biofactory. Cannot be built if the City contains an Autoplant, Drone Hive, or Utility Fog.

+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from each worked Forest tile. Increases the production of Mutants, Chimeras, and Bio-Titans. Melee, Gun, Ranged, and Scout units receive the Gengineered promotion. Requires a Biofactory. Cannot be built if the City contains an Autoplant, Drone Hive, or Utility Fog.

As the creation and even mass production of artificially-engineered genetic chimeras became more common, so did facilities dedicated to the task. Biogenesis pods were the most integral component in these facilities, as they allowed genetic manipulation of chimeras even during the incubation process, so that they could be dynamically adjusted to meet varying needs. These facilities also often served double-duty as biomodification centres, as the pods could be used to modify humans as well, although they could only perform more rudimentary and large-scale modifications, compared to the later and more sophisticated birthing pods.
Bioenhancement Centre
Increases the production of Organic Infantry and Biotroopers. Melee, Gun, Ranged, and Scout units receive the Biomod promotion. Requires a Biofactory and an Implant Clinic.
Increases the production of Organic Infantry and Biotroopers. Melee, Gun, Ranged, and Scout units receive the Biomod promotion. Requires a Biofactory and an Implant Clinic.

While implant clinics permitted a certain degree of biomodifications, more extensive adaptations required more sophisticated equipment. Biomod facilities carried out more extensive human modification, typically immersing the subject in a suspension tank so that more complex implants and full-body modfications could be carried out. Common biomods included stimplants, that would provide a short-term regenerative capability, as well as boost mods that enhanced combat capabilities.
Genejack Facility
Adds [ICON_GOLD] Gold to Grasslands and Plain tiles, and adds 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to Tundra, Snow, and Desert tiles. Provides 1 [ICON_RES_NANOMAT] Nanomaterials.
Adds [ICON_GOLD] Gold to Grasslands and Plain tiles, and adds 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to Tundra, Snow, and Desert tiles. Provides 1 [ICON_RES_NANOMAT] Nanomaterials.

As biofactories began to use an increasing variety of organic components and processes in the manufacturing of advanced materials and equipment, they began to run into limitations due to the restrictive environmental controls that were required for biotechnological process to be most efficient. With the advancement of transgenics, however, these processes could be further refined by tailoring the organisms used in various biomanufacturing, enabling them to work even more efficiently, and in increasingly harsher environments. There have been rumors that this process of "genejacking" was even applied to human workers that were employed in biofactories and other genejack facilities, but no conclusive evidence of this has been found.
Ecosanctuary
Adds 1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and 1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for each Nature Preserve worked by the city.
Adds 1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and 1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for each Nature Preserve worked by the city.

In communities where ecological philosophies took a strong hold, there was felt a deep-seated need for a way to feel connected with the remaining regions of wild nature surrounding them. While nature preserves offered the most enjoyable opportunities, not everyone could spare the time and resources to enjoy even local preserves. As a result, these communities began to develop ecosanctuaries, natural preserves located within the communities themselves. While still artificial to a certain degree as a necessity, they were much wilder and more natural than vivariums, allowing the populace to feel a much greater connection to the natural world. These refuges often ended up as cultural centres, inspiring various works of art, music, and literature.
Nanoforge
Increases the production of military units by 15%. Requires an Autoplant.
Increases the production of military units by 15%. Requires an Autoplant.
The Nanoforge is a facility dedicated to producing new materials and equipment utilizing nanotechnology.
Aerospace Complex
Increases the air unit capacity of a city by 6. Increases the production of Drone Fighters and Suborbital Bombers.
Increases the air unit capacity of a city by 6. Increases the production of Drone Fighters and Suborbital Bombers.

With the increasing commercialization and development of space, facilities dedicated to the maintenance and servicing of aerospace craft became increasingly necessary. These dedicated facilities often combined manufacturing facilities with buildings to help service aerospace craft and people travelling to and from orbit.
Converter

Produces 2 [ICON_RES_NANOMAT] Nanomaterials. Each source of [ICON_RES_COAL] Coal and [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil worked by this city produce +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. City must have at least one of these resources improved with a Mine or Well.

Produces 2 [ICON_RES_NANOMAT] Nanomaterials. Each source of [ICON_RES_COAL] Coal and [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil worked by this city produce +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. City must have at least one of these resources improved with a Mine or Well.

Advances in the field of microscale engineering helped further advance the development of nanomaterials. While the original nanomaterial plants required very specific environments and raw materials to work with, more sophisticated nanoscale machines, while not true nanotechnology, helped make the process easier and less intensive. Raw materials such as coal or oil could be fed into specially-built converters, and the nanoscale machines would dutifully work to convert these into useful nanomaterials. Although there were concerns that these early nanomachines could potentially run amok, converting any organic material they found into nanomaterials, the relatively simple construction of these nanoscale machines meant they still need a protected environment to work, and were unlikely to survive long in the wild. Their programming and design was also still relatively limited, as they could only convert certain materials into others, and could not, for example, construct copies of themselves. Still, many more ecologically-minded societies considered converters a serious risk to the environment.
Particle Accelerator
Nearby Academies are converted to High-Energy Research Centres, as are Academies constructed after it is built . Gain a free Great Scientist. Requires a Research Lab in every city.
Nearby Academies are converted to High-Energy Research Centres, as are Academies constructed after it is built . Gain a free Great Scientist. Requires a Research Lab in every city.

The Particle Accelerator is a significant piece of scientific equipment, enabling the investigation of physical phenomena under high-energy conditions. This helps further research into such fields as quantum theory and astrophysics.
Implant Clinic
Requires a Hospital.
Requires a Hospital.
As implant technology improved, an increasing number of implant clinics began to appear, offering implantation services to a rapidly growing market.
Birthing Pods
Requires an Implant Clinic.
Requires an Implant Clinic.

As the process of in vitro genetic modification of humans became increasingly commonplace, so did the process of artificial incubation. Increasing numbers of children were gestated in artificial wombs, sparing their parents the physical trauma of childbirth while also allowing continual monitoring of the process, to avoid any complications. Eventually, these became dedicated facilities became known as birthing pods, similar to the ectogenesis pods used to produce chimeras. Unlike the ectogenesis pods, however, these facilities were capable of providing a complete suite of genetic and medical treatments for infants, and were considered in many communities the preferred means to produce children.
Biofactory
Adds 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to Grass and Plains tiles worked by the City.
Adds 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to Grass and Plains tiles worked by the City.

As society became more ecologically conscious, the impact that heavy industry can have upon the environment also became increasingly scrutinized. Under increasing social pressure, industries began to try and find more ecologically-friendly ways to maintain production, switching their existing factories and industrial plants over to newer "biofactories", that had a reduced impact on both the natural environment, as well as the humans that worked in and around them. Eventually, these "biofactories" became similar to the synthecologies that were becoming common in some areas -- artificially created environments that served industrial needs. The most sophisticated of these incorporated modified humans into the ecological infrastructure, and the engineered ecologies were so sophisticated they could manufacture materials similar to basic nanotechnological processes.
Network Backbone

Adds 1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for each Research Server in the empire, adds 1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each Entertainment Server in the empire, and adds 1 [ICON_GOLD] for each Comm Array in the City's radius. Requires a Server Hub. Cannot be built if the City contains an Information Hub, Distribution Hub, or Metroplex Hub.

Adds 1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for each Research Server in the empire, adds 1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each Entertainment Server in the empire, and adds 1 [ICON_GOLD] for each Comm Array in the City's radius. Requires a Server Hub. Cannot be built if the City contains an Information Hub, Distribution Hub, or Metroplex Hub.

With interconnected computer systems becoming increasingly prevalent in society, some researchers and engineers started to grow concerned about how much information traffic could actually be handled by existing networks. Increasingly sophisticated means to handle data transfers between remote systems were developed, and in some cities dedicated infrastructure was laid down to accomodate these. This new infrastructure would form a backbone for future information technologies and data networks, particularly with the advent of neural-direct interfaces, as they could permit enormous quantities of data to be transmitted clearly and without errors. They also made existing computer servers even more accessible to everyone, greatly increasing the dissemination of new ideas. However, they competed with the increasingly expansive feedsite networks, and many communities that had limited space and bandwidth had to decide which to prioritize.
Cyberclinic
Requires a Research Lab.
Requires a Research Lab.

As increasing numbers of humans are cybernetically modified, the ready access to such technology becomes an increasing concern. Whether operated by the government to ensure equal access for all, or privately as a response to market pressures, increasing numbers of cyberclinics are established, helping ensure that anyone who wants to can have their bodies cybernetically modified. Initially they offered simple neural grafting and interfaces, but as the development of cybernetic prostheses advanced, they became capable of offering an increasingly wide variety of enhancements.
Telepresence Hub

Adds 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] and 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each Cyberclinic in the empire. Requires a Network Backbone. Cannot be built if the City contains an Information Hub, Distribution Hub, or Metroplex Hub.

Adds 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] and 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each Cyberclinic in the empire. Requires a Network Backbone. Cannot be built if the City contains an Information Hub, Distribution Hub, or Metroplex Hub.

With the further advancement of cybernetics and the increasing number of individuals with neural direct interfaces that permitted them to control prosthetic bodies remotely, it became increasingly common for people to use telepresence to work or visit more remote communities. As long as these cities were linked via a network backbone, people in other cities could commute instantly by remotely operating a prosthetic body. As the number of individuals telecommuting in this fashion increased, it becamse necessary to establish facilities that stored the needed prosthetic bodies for ease of maintenance and access. These telepresence hubs were often located either centrally in the community, or near sites that were regularly frequented, such as work sites or popular tourist locations.
AI Network

Each AI Network in the empire adds 1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and 1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. Adds 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each Support Node in the city's radius. Requires a Network Backbone. Cannot be built if the City contains an Information Hub, Distribution Hub, or Metroplex Hub.

Each AI Network in the empire adds 1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and 1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. Adds 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each Support Node in the city's radius. Requires a Network Backbone. Cannot be built if the City contains an Information Hub, Distribution Hub, or Metroplex Hub.

With the advent of artificial intelligence, an increasing number of AIs were utilized to help run various facilities more efficiently, as well as assist humans with scientific and even cultural endeavors. Wariness of artificial intelligences meant that many were kept isolated, but some civilizations with extensive network connections chose to allow AIs to network amongst themselves. These networks allowed the AIs to distribute their tasks and collaborate, resulting in even greater accomplishments than they could have produced on their own.
Brain Uploading Facility

1/4 of the [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City become uploaded. They can no longer work tiles or fill specialist slots, but provide 2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, 2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, 2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and 2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture each. Requires a Cyberclinic.

1/4 of the [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City become uploaded. They can no longer work tiles or fill specialist slots, but provide 2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, 2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, 2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and 2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture each. Requires a Cyberclinic.

With the advancement of computer technology, the capability to duplicate a human mind was achieved. This lead to the process of "brain uploading", where a human brain would be perfectly duplicated in digital form, allowing human minds to exist in a digital form similar to artificial intelligences. With the increasing availability of robotic surrogates and virtual environments, these uploaded minds were fully capable of interacting with the physical world and other humans, although they no longer required food or other amenities to survive.
Vivarium
Adds 1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for each Hydroponics Dome worked by the city. Requires an Aqueduct, and the city must not contain an Ecosanctuary.
Adds 1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for each Hydroponics Dome worked by the city. Requires an Aqueduct, and the city must not contain an Ecosanctuary.

Improvements in technology made it increasingly viable to artificially sustain ecosystems, initially on a small, but increasingly larger scale. These artificial environments became known as "vivariums", and could range from arid desert environments to aquatic ones. As more communities were built in harsh and hostile environments, vivariums became an important source of both food and mental health, as residents could utilize the vivariums to grow useful food sources as well as spend time enjoying the comfort of the environment. As vivariums provided a sense of nature through plants, streams, waterfalls in a convenient location while avoiding some of the more troublesome aspects of travelling to nature preserves and other wilder locations, such as travel time and inclement weather, these societies slowly developed an innate preference for these controlled environments over more natural ones.
Drone Hive
Adds 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for each Generator in the city's radius. Requires an Autoplant. Cannot be built if the City contains a Biofactory, Genejack Facility, or Biogenesis Pods.
Adds 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for each Generator in the city's radius. Requires an Autoplant. Cannot be built if the City contains a Biofactory, Genejack Facility, or Biogenesis Pods.

As autonomous robots and drones became increasingly prevalent, the need for dedicated facilities to maintain and monitor them became apparent. Specialized facilities that drones could use as a 'home base', commonly called 'drone hives', were established in cities that had a significant usage of drones. With this dedicated support, drones could travel further and operate more reliably, enabling them to help handle some of the tasks humans did before.
Autoplant
+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each E-Commerce Server in the empire. Requires a Factory. Cannot be built if the City contains a Biofactory, Genejack Facility, or Biogenesis Pods.
+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each E-Commerce Server in the empire. Requires a Factory. Cannot be built if the City contains a Biofactory, Genejack Facility, or Biogenesis Pods.

While industry had continued to become increasingly automated, human supervision and intervention was still a necessity. After all, early robots were only as effective as they were instructed to be. As increasingly autonomous machines were developed, however, it was increasingly possible to eliminate the necessity for a human presence in these often-hazardous work environments. Autonomous manufacturing and industrial facilities became increasingly common, improving productivity while also protecting human health and safety. These automated facilities particularly benefited from the spread of e-commerce, as the entire process of manufacturing and purchasing goods required no human intervention and could be done nation-wide.
Undersea Mining Platform
+2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] from Coast and Ocean tiles. Requires a Harbor, and the city must not contain an Aquaculture Lab.
+2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] from Coast and Ocean tiles. Requires a Harbor, and the city must not contain an Aquaculture Lab.

The increasing sophistication of robotic and drone technologies meant that some of the most hazardous environments on the planet could now be accessed. The ocean floor had always been a potential source of resources such a manganese, but the difficulty of accessing them had left these resources untouched. Now, with remote-controlled drones and robots, these resources could be mined efficiently for industrial use. However, the presence of these industrial worksites and their waste byproducts often interfered with aquaculture efforts.
Utility Fog Generator

Increases City Defense and [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness. Buildings are constructed 20% faster. Requires a Drone Hive. Cannot be built if the City contains a Biofactory, Genejack Facility, or Biogenesis Pods.

Increases City Defense and [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness. Buildings are constructed 20% faster. Requires a Drone Hive. Cannot be built if the City contains a Biofactory, Genejack Facility, or Biogenesis Pods.

Increasingly sophisticated and intelligent nanomachines allowed the development of utility fogs -- collections of tiny robots that can bind together to replicate physical structures. Initially they were conceived for protective purposes, remaining in a loose and fluid state until a sudden impact stimulated them to bind together, spreading impacts across a broad surface. However, they can also be used to produce any physical object, or even transport individuals from place to place.
Nucleonic Foundry

Produces 6 [ICON_RES_NANOMAT] Nanomaterials. Each source of [ICON_RES_ALUMINUM] Aluminum and [ICON_RES_URANIUM] Uranium worked by this city produce +4 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Requires 2 [ICON_RES_URANIUM] Uranium and a Fusion Plant.

Produces 6 [ICON_RES_NANOMAT] Nanomaterials. Each source of [ICON_RES_ALUMINUM] Aluminum and [ICON_RES_URANIUM] Uranium worked by this city produce +4 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Requires 2 [ICON_RES_URANIUM] Uranium and a Fusion Plant.

Once a means to produce superheavy elements was discovered, it was inevitable that they would be put to industrial use. The enormous quantities of energy, as well as the precision equipment required to control the conditions of their manufacture made these facilities rare, however. They required a dedicated fusion reactor at the very least, and often utilized existing heavy elements such as uranium to make the process of synthesizing superheavy nuclei easier. The materials that they produced, however, were almost indestructible, and enabled the creation of some of the largest and most impressive artificial constructs mankind has ever achieved.
Vertical Farm
Adds 1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every Hydroponic Dome worked by City. Requires an Aqueduct. Cannot be built if the City already has a Genemod Lab, Cloning Lab, or Transgenic Nursery.
Adds 1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every Hydroponic Dome worked by City. Requires an Aqueduct. Cannot be built if the City already has a Genemod Lab, Cloning Lab, or Transgenic Nursery.

Vertical farming is the practice of producing food in vertically stacked layers, vertically inclined surfaces and/or integrated in other structures. The modern idea of vertical farming uses controlled-environment agriculture (CEA) technology, where all environmental factors can be controlled. These facilities utilize artificial control of light, environmental control (humidity, temperature, gases...) and fertigation. Some vertical farms use techniques similar to greenhouses, where natural sunlight can be augmented with artificial lighting and metal reflectors. Integrated into the structures of major cities, these farms provide a local source of food independent of climate and soil conditions.
Mycoprotein Vats
Adds 1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City. Requires a Vertical Farm. Cannot be built if the City already has a Genemod Lab, Cloning Lab, or Transgenic Nursery.
Adds 1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City. Requires a Vertical Farm. Cannot be built if the City already has a Genemod Lab, Cloning Lab, or Transgenic Nursery.

While various methods of increasing food production have been developed over the centuries, population growth in some areas threatened to outstrip even the best efforts of farms and hydroponic domes. As a result, some communities turned towards the mass production of nutritionally complete food substitutes, using various processes to synthesize proteins and fibres fit for human consumption. The resulting food substitutes were sufficiently nutritious, but frequently lacked the taste and texture of real food. Still, for many mycoprotein foods were the only nutrition they could afford, and mycoprotein vats helped sustain millions.
Orbital Habitat

Adds 1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for each Specialist in a Research Module, Engineering Module, or Comm Module in the City. Requires Mycoprotein Vats. Cannot be built if the City already has a Genemod Lab, Cloning Lab, or Transgenic Nursery.

Adds 1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for each Specialist in a Research Module, Engineering Module, or Comm Module in the City. Requires Mycoprotein Vats. Cannot be built if the City already has a Genemod Lab, Cloning Lab, or Transgenic Nursery.

Perhaps the ultimate method of artificial food cultivation, the Orbital Habitat establishes a completely self-contained agricultural environment in space. While most early space stations were dependent on food supplies shipped up from the planet's surface (at incredible expense), the Orbital Habitat permitted a space station to become nearly self-sufficient, growing much of the food required by the people working there. While the food produced by early habitats was little better than mycorprotein supplements, over time they became increasingly advanced and sophisticated, using hydroponic and aeroponic techniques to grow a variety of vegetables and plants to help sustain their crews.
Information Hub

Provides +1 [ICON_CULTURE] for each Great Work in the City, and +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] for each Colosseum, Zoo, and Stadium in the City. Requires a Server Hub. Cannot be built if the City contains a Network Backbone, Telepresence Hub, or AI Network.

Provides +1 [ICON_CULTURE] for each Great Work in the City, and +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] for each Colosseum, Zoo, and Stadium in the City. Requires a Server Hub. Cannot be built if the City contains a Network Backbone, Telepresence Hub, or AI Network.

While media networks had been providing entertainment to the people for decades, the rise of the enormous habitats put a strain on the media infrastructure. Information Hubs were incorporated into the construction of new habitats, ensuring their residents had access to cultural media and entertainment, although their centralized design meant the capital tends to dominate the feeds. As their popularity rose, however, some communities found that they lacked sufficient infrastructure for both Information Hub networks and the network backbones connecting Server Hubs. With populations demanding entertainment, many favored the centrally-organized Information Hub over the more distributed network backbones.
Distribution Hub

Provides +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City. Adds +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for each Industrial Site worked by the City. Requires an Information Hub. Cannot be built if the City contains a Network Backbone, Telepresence Hub, or AI Network.

Provides +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City. Adds +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for each Industrial Site worked by the City. Requires an Information Hub. Cannot be built if the City contains a Network Backbone, Telepresence Hub, or AI Network.

As Information Hubs became increasingly prevalent in the larger cities, city managers began to look at how else they could use the integrated data networks. Using these networks to help make the distribution of raw materials for industry, and consumer goods for the populace, was one of the most immediate developments. By being able to track the flow of goods through the city, as well as the processes of production and consumption, both businesses and consumers benefitted from an increase in efficiency through the centralized distribution hubs.
Metroplex Hub

Provides +1 [ICON_GOLD] for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City. Adds +1 [ICON_GOLD] Production for each Arcology worked by the City. Requires a Distribution Hub. Cannot be built if the City contains a Network Backbone, Telepresence Hub, or AI Network.

Provides +1 [ICON_GOLD] for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City. Adds +1 [ICON_GOLD] Production for each Arcology worked by the City. Requires a Distribution Hub. Cannot be built if the City contains a Network Backbone, Telepresence Hub, or AI Network.

With the successful emergence of centralized distribution hubs in the largest cities, and the increasing population capacity of arcologies, the largest metroplexes began to take steps to ensure that their increasingly massive communities ran efficiently. Centralized city planning helped ensure that people and commerce were able to flow freely, even during peak business hours. While some objected to what was sometimes strict regulation in population and business zoning, the new metroplex arrangements ensured that people and commerce were able to flow freely through the city.
